<ce:section-title id="sect0040">Synthesis of <ce:bold>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Co-PYIs</ce:bold>
</ce:section-title><ce:para id="par0050" view="all">The <ce:bold>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Co-PYI1</ce:bold> was prepared by the self-assembly approach under hydrothermal conditions. A mixture of [(n-C<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>N]<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>[W<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>] (66.4 mg, 0.02 mmol), Co(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·3H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (60.0 mg, 0.20 mmol), NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-BPY (10.3 mg, 0.06 mmol) and L-BCIP (7.5 mg, 0.03 mmol) were mixed in 4 mL of water and 2 mL of methanol solution. The resultant mixture was stirred for 12 h, then pH value was adjusted to 4.3 with acetic acid (HAc) and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined autoclave, and maintained at 130 °C for 3 days. After cooling the autoclave to room temperature, black rod-like single crystals were separated, washed with water and air-dried. (Yield: calculated (calcd) 72% based on [(n-C<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>N]<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>[W<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>]). Elemental analyses and inductively coupled plasma calcd (%) for C<ce:inf loc="post">38</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">55</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">42.5</ce:inf>W<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>Co<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>: C 12.12, H 1.45, N 4.84, Co 4.71, W 58.74;. Found: C 12.14, H 1.47, N 4.84, Co 4.70, W 58.72 for <ce:bold>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Co-PYI1</ce:bold>. IR (KBr; ν): 3422 (br, s), 1602 (s), 1425 (m), 1099 (w), 931 (s, W = Ot), 873 (s,W-O-W), 765 (s,W-O-W) cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>.</ce:para><ce:para id="par0055" view="all">The preparation of <ce:bold>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Co-PYI2</ce:bold> was similar to that of <ce:bold>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Co-PYI1</ce:bold>, except that D-BCIP (50.0 mg, 0.2 mmol) replaced L-BCIP. (Yield: ca. 75% based on [(n-C<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>N]<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>[W<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>]). Elemental analyses and inductively coupled plasma calcd (%) for C<ce:inf loc="post">38</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">54</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">42</ce:inf>W<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>Co<ce:inf loc="post">2.5</ce:inf>: C 12.25, H 1.47, N 4.90, Co 3.94, W 59.32;. Found: C 12.27, H 1.46, N 4.89, Co 3.96, W 59.33 for <ce:bold>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Co-PYI2</ce:bold>.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="sect0075">Catalysis Knoevenagel/Aldol condensation</ce:section-title><ce:para id="par0080" view="all">Knoevenagel condensation has been considered as one of the most important reactions for generating <ce:italic>α,β</ce:italic>-unsaturated carbonyl compounds by additive reaction of aromatic aldehydes with activated methylene compounds [,]. In this work, <ce:bold>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Co-PYIs</ce:bold> are explored in the new synergic catalytic system for Lewis base NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> and Lewis acid Co(II) coexisting in one framework, which can effectively active the substrates in a synergistic cooperation for the preparation of substituted alkene derivatives. We initially investigated reaction conditions using benzaldehyde and ethyl acetoacetate as a model substrate with <ce:bold>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-Co-PYI1</ce:bold> in a heterogeneous mixture at 45 °C for seven days, which furnished the yield almost up to 100% (
<ce:float-anchor refid="tbl0010"></ce:float-anchor>, Entry 1) (see SI for additional information). The excellent reaction efficiency revealed the successful execution of our design.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of NH2-Co-PYIs 

The NH2-Co-PYI1 was prepared by the self-assembly approach under hydrothermal conditions. A mixture of [(n-C4H9)4N]4[W10O32] (66.4mg, 0.02mmol), Co(NO3)2⋅3H2O (60.0mg, 0.20mmol), NH2-BPY (10.3mg, 0.06mmol) and L-BCIP (7.5mg, 0.03mmol) were mixed in 4mL of water and 2mL of methanol solution. The resultant mixture was stirred for 12h, then pH value was adjusted to 4.3 with acetic acid (HAc) and sealed in a 25mL Teflon-lined autoclave, and maintained at 130°C for 3 days. After cooling the autoclave to room temperature, black rod-like single crystals were separated, washed with water and air-dried. (Yield: calculated (calcd) 72% based on [(n-C4H9)4N]4[W10O32]). Elemental analyses and inductively coupled plasma calcd (%) for C38H55N13O42.5W12Co3: C 12.12, H 1.45, N 4.84, Co 4.71, W 58.74;. Found: C 12.14, H 1.47, N 4.84, Co 4.70, W 58.72 for NH2-Co-PYI1. IR (KBr; ν): 3422 (br, s), 1602 (s), 1425 (m), 1099 (w), 931 (s, W=Ot), 873 (s,W-O-W), 765 (s,W-O-W) cm-1.

The preparation of NH2-Co-PYI2 was similar to that of NH2-Co-PYI1, except that D-BCIP (50.0mg, 0.2mmol) replaced L-BCIP. (Yield: ca. 75% based on [(n-C4H9)4N]4[W10O32]). Elemental analyses and inductively coupled plasma calcd (%) for C38H54N13O42W12Co2.5: C 12.25, H 1.47, N 4.90, Co 3.94, W 59.32;. Found: C 12.27, H 1.46, N 4.89, Co 3.96, W 59.33 for NH2-Co-PYI2.

Catalysis Knoevenagel/Aldol condensation

Knoevenagel condensation has been considered as one of the most important reactions for generating α,β-unsaturated carbonyl compounds by additive reaction of aromatic aldehydes with activated methylene compounds [,]. In this work, NH2-Co-PYIs are explored in the new synergic catalytic system for Lewis base NH2 and Lewis acid Co(II) coexisting in one framework, which can effectively active the substrates in a synergistic cooperation for the preparation of substituted alkene derivatives. We initially investigated reaction conditions using benzaldehyde and ethyl acetoacetate as a model substrate with NH2-Co-PYI1 in a heterogeneous mixture at 45°C for seven days, which furnished the yield almost up to 100% ( , Entry 1) (see SI for additional information). The excellent reaction efficiency revealed the successful execution of our design.
